cedar.processing.sources.Boost.name: Boost
cedar.processing.sources.Boost.comments: can remove once space-color wm tracks color change properly

cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.name: boosted
cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.comments: object with changing hue is detected

cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.name: cut int
cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.comments: sustained peak for all concept nodes

cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.name: fast ++
cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.comments: fire only when postive hue change happens

cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.name: space-color selection
cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.comments: single peak at intersection of priming and wm

cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.name: target repr
cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.comments: by default, all objects except the tool object can be a target

cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.name: tool repr      wm
cedar.dynamics.NeuralField.comments: sustained after finding tool is finished

ui.text:
- space-color wm: tracking moving obj (currently make a line for space, and no movement for color)
problem: lateral exci needed to sustain peaks, at the same obj right next to should make the peak move along feature dim.	
- space-color selection: single obj, no memory
- tool repr wm: memory
- tool priming: multiple obj
- target repr: tool repr wm should have bigger amplitude to really inhibit target repr at right place
target binding and matching isn't done yet
selection should be possible without any priming as well. Use slow time scale to slowly build up bottom up saliency, while priming 'primes' certain location

[Current scenario]
Due to higher priming val, knife is found as tool in the first hypo. However CoD fires and in the new search, hand is found as the tool.
saliency might need sustained repr of salient features?
